actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-266, by Mr. Moakley.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2748 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. All points of order against the bill for failure to comply with the provisions of sections 302(c) and 302(f) of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974, as amended, and with the provisions of clause 5(a) of rule XXI are waived. Measure will be read by title. Bill is open to amendments. The amendments printed in section two of this resolution shall be considered as having been adopted and shall become original text for the purpose of further amendment under the five-minute rule.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 61.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 2748) to authorize appropriations for the fiscal year 1990 for intelligence and intelligence-related activities of the United States Government, for the Intelligence Community Staff, for the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 2748 (intelligence services funding).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 2748) to authorize appropriations for the fiscal year 1990 for intelligence and intelligence-related activities of the United States Government, for the Intelligence Community Staff, for the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System, and for other purposes.
